intro: Pilosella trichodenta, commonly known as the hairy leaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, surrounded by finely hairy leaves. Pilosella trichodenta is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun. Its fibrous roots and low-growing habit make it a hardy perennial suitable for ornamental gardening.
